ask.title: Ask Your Knowledge Base
ask.subtitle: Get AI-powered answers from your curated content
ask.question: Question
ask.questionPlaceholder: Ask anything... e.g., What would Warren Buffett think about recent tech layoffs?
ask.enableInSettings: Enable the Q&A experimental feature in Settings to start asking questions about your knowledge base.

hero.title: Surface signal from noise
hero.subtitle: Aha Radar monitors your chosen sources and delivers personalized digests of only the most relevant content.

personalized.title: Personalized
personalized.description: Your preferences shape what surfaces. Like and dislike to train your radar.

multiSource.title: Multi-source
multiSource.description: Reddit, Hacker News, RSS, YouTube, and more. All normalized and deduplicated.

budgetAware.title: Budget-aware
budgetAware.description: Control your processing costs with configurable daily and monthly limits.

login.title: Welcome back
login.subtitle: Sign in to your account
login.checkEmailDescription: We sent a login link to {email}
login.invalidToken: Invalid or expired link. Please request a new one.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.noDigests: No digests yet. Configure your sources to get started.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.colorModeDescription: Light, dark, or match your system

viewing.title: Viewing Profile
viewing.description: How often do you check your feed?
viewing.decayHoursDescription: How quickly older items fade in relevance

profileDescriptions.power: For checking multiple times per day

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: Configure viewing profile settings for each topic. Click a topic to expand its settings.
topics.noTopics: No topics configured yet. Topics will appear here once created.
topics.name: Name

experimental.title: Experimental Features
experimental.info: Toggle experimental features on or off. These features are in development and may change or be removed.
experimental.serverNote: Note: Some features also require server-side configuration (QA_ENABLED=true in .env). The toggle here controls client-side access.

qa.label: Q&A / Ask Your Knowledge Base
qa.description: Ask natural language questions about your ingested content. Uses cluster-based RAG to search and generate answers with citations.

dev.title: Developer Settings
dev.warning: These settings are for local development only. API credentials are stored in your browser's localStorage.
dev.apiBaseUrlHint: The base URL of your API server (e.g., http://localhost:3001/api)
dev.apiKeyHint: Your API key for authentication (X-API-Key header)

toast.linkSent: Magic link sent! Check your email.
toast.feedbackError: Failed to save feedback. Please try again.

account.title: Account
account.confirmLogout: Are you sure you want to sign out?

admin.title: Admin
admin.description: Manage your pipeline, sources, and budgets

users.title: Users
users.accessDeniedDescription: You need admin privileges to view this page.

run.title: Run Pipeline
run.topicHint: Run pipeline for sources assigned to this topic
run.providerOverrideHint: Override LLM provider for this run only

sources.title: Sources Management
sources.name: Name
sources.weightHint: Higher weight (1.0-3.0) gives this source more influence on ranking
sources.weightDescription: Higher weight = more influence on ranking
sources.configHint: Optional JSON config for the source connector

typeDescriptions.arxiv: Track arXiv research papers by category

budgets.title: Budget Status
budgets.description: Monitor your credit usage and limits
budgets.degradedModeDescription: Budget exhausted. Pipeline running in low-cost mode.

llm.title: LLM Settings
llm.description: Configure which AI provider and model to use for pipeline processing

providerDescriptions.openai: Uses your OpenAI API key from .env. No rate limiting needed.
providerDescriptions.anthropic: Uses your Anthropic API key from .env. No rate limiting needed.
providerDescriptions.claude-subscription: Uses Claude Code CLI with your $100/mo Max subscription. Requires terminal login.
providerDescriptions.codex-subscription: Uses Codex CLI with your ChatGPT subscription (Plus $20, Pro $200). Requires terminal login.

llm.openaiModelDescription: Specify the OpenAI model to use (e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-turbo)
llm.claudeModelDescription: Specify the Claude model to use (e.g., claude-sonnet-4-5)
llm.claudeLoginRequired: You must be logged into Claude Code CLI in your terminal (run 'claude' to verify)
llm.codexLoginRequired: You must be logged into Codex CLI in your terminal (run 'codex' to verify)
llm.subscriptionLocalOnly: Only works when running locally - not for deployed/cloud environments
llm.subscriptionPersonalUse: For personal use only - shared usage not supported
llm.claudeRateLimitHint: Default: 100/hr. Claude Code Max allows sustained usage. Reduce if you hit rate limits.
llm.codexRateLimitHint: ChatGPT Plus: ~6-30 calls/hr (very limited). Pro: ~60-300/hr. Increase if you have Pro.
llm.claudeRateLimitWarning: Pipeline runs blocked if expected triage calls exceed remaining quota. Quota resets hourly.
llm.codexRateLimitWarning: Pipeline runs blocked if expected triage calls exceed remaining quota. Quota resets hourly.

ops.title: Operations
ops.description: Monitor worker health and access ops tools

abtests.title: AB Tests
abtests.description: Compare LLM configurations side by side
abtests.disabled: AB tests are disabled. Set ENABLE_ABTESTS=true in your environment to enable this feature.
abtests.noRunsDescription: Create an AB test to compare how different LLM models triage the same content.

new.title: Create AB Test
new.topicHint: Select the topic to sample content items from
new.maxItemsHint: Maximum number of content items to test (default: 120, max: 200)
new.variantsHint: Configure at least 2 LLM variants to compare

detail.title: AB Test Results
detail.noResults: No results yet. The test may still be running.

list.emptyDescription: Digests will appear here after your first pipeline run.

whyShown.title: Why shown
whyShown.unavailableReason: Triage was not run for this item

feed.caughtUpError: Failed to mark as caught up

topics.emptyDescription: Create your first topic to organize sources and personalize your feed.
topics.guidance: Organize content by creating topics for different interests. Consider splitting a topic when sources have very different content types (news vs memes), or when one source consistently gets buried by others.
topics.confirmDeleteTopicDescription: This will permanently delete the topic and all associated settings. Sources will be moved to the default topic.

depth.title: Depth & Coverage
depth.hint: Higher depth increases digest items, triage calls, and deep summaries. High mode is for deep dives; normal is the default; low is cost-efficient.

feed.selectTopicForCaughtUp: Select a topic to mark as caught up
feed.title: Feed
feed.subtitle: All your ranked items in one place
feed.emptyDescription: Items will appear here after running the pipeline.

onboarding.subtitle: Get started with personalized content
onboarding.title: Welcome to your feed
onboarding.message: Set up your first topic to start discovering relevant content from across the web.
onboarding.step1: Create a topic to organize your interests
onboarding.step2: Add sources like Reddit, HN, RSS, or X
onboarding.step3: Run the pipeline to fetch and rank items

tooltips.ahaScore: Your personalized relevance score. Combines AI analysis with freshness, novelty, and your preferences. Higher = more relevant to you right now.
tooltips.aiScore: AI's assessment of how relevant this item is to your topic (0-100). This raw score is then adjusted by freshness, novelty, and your preferences.
tooltips.novelty: How unique this content is compared to what you've seen recently. Higher = more novel information.
tooltips.freshness: How recent this content is. Older items gradually fade to make room for new ones.
tooltips.sourceWeight: Priority multiplier for this source. Sources you trust more can be weighted higher.
tooltips.userPreferences: Boosts applied based on your liked sources and authors.
tooltips.categories: Topics the AI identified in this content.
tooltips.feedbackLike: Mark as interesting - helps surface similar content in the future.
tooltips.feedbackDislike: Mark as not relevant - helps filter out similar content.
tooltips.feedbackSave: Bookmark for later (also trains preferences like Like).
tooltips.feedbackSkip: Dismiss from inbox without training preferences.
tooltips.sourceHN: Hacker News - tech news and community discussions.
tooltips.sourceSignal: X/Twitter search signal via Grok AI.
tooltips.sourcesInterval: How often this source is checked for new content.
tooltips.sourcesWeight: Priority multiplier for items from this source (1.0 = normal).
tooltips.clusterSources: This topic has coverage from {count} sources. Expand 'Why shown' below to see all related sources.
tooltips.relatedSources: Multiple sources covered this topic. Similarity % shows how related each source is to the main item.

sourcePicker.title: Choose Source Type
sourcePicker.subtitle: Select a source type to add to your topic
sourcePicker.starterPacksIntro: Pre-configured source templates for common use cases. X via Grok can serve as a free alternative to some paid data APIs when information is posted publicly.
sourcePicker.starterPacksDisclaimer: These are convenience presets. Verify accuracy; not official data sources.
